entry.title: Sept 10th Smoke Outlook
entry.summary: The smoke outlook for Thompson Falls and Plains areas is looking much better today and will continue to improve throughout the afternoon. However, people that are sensitive to smoke should still limit their exposure by staying indoors or limiting physical exercise outside. For more details, please see the link to the right.
entry.content: The smoke outlook for Thompson Falls and Plains areas is looking much better today and will continue to improve throughout the afternoon. However, people that are sensitive to smoke should still limit their exposure by staying indoors or limiting physical exercise outside. For more details, please see the link to the right.

entry.title: West Peak Fire Afternoon Update 09/09/17
entry.summary: The visiblity has improved today and helicopters have been able to assist the firefighting efforts on both fires. The projected winds have not developed over the #WestForkFire, and the Bobtail Ridge Burnout continues to progress slowly. #MoosePeakFire has been more active today in the Fisher Creek area, however no major fire runs have been observed.
entry.content: The visiblity has improved today and helicopters have been able to assist the firefighting efforts on both fires. The projected winds have not developed over the #WestForkFire, and the Bobtail Ridge Burnout continues to progress slowly. #MoosePeakFire has been more active today in the Fisher Creek area, however no major fire runs have been observed.

entry.title: Pre-Evacuation Warnings Update
entry.summary: Message from Sheriff Rummel: At 2:00 PM, on 09/08/17, pre-evacuations we're started in the following areas: ·Guy Hall Rd. (Approx. MM 43.5) East Along Hwy 200 to Prospect Creek (Hwy 471). ·Clear Creek & Cherry Creek. These pre-evacuations were initiated in advance of a significant wind event that is predicted to impact Sanders County. Winds are expected to start at approximately 2:00 PM and continue to 9:00 PM Sunday night. Sanders County Sheriff's Office in conjunction with the Type II team will continue to monitor the situation throughout the weekend. Thank you, Sheriff Rummel.
entry.content: Message from Sheriff Rummel: At 2:00 PM, on 09/08/17, pre-evacuations we're started in the following areas: ·Guy Hall Rd. (Approx. MM 43.5) East Along Hwy 200 to Prospect Creek (Hwy 471). ·Clear Creek & Cherry Creek. These pre-evacuations were initiated in advance of a significant wind event that is predicted to impact Sanders County. Winds are expected to start at approximately 2:00 PM and continue to 9:00 PM Sunday night. Sanders County Sheriff's Office in conjunction with the Type II team will continue to monitor the situation throughout the weekend. Thank you, Sheriff Rummel.

entry.title: Air Operations Update 09/09/17
entry.summary: The visibility has improved over the fire area today. Three helicopters have been dispatch to Moose Peak Fire and will be available to the West Fork Fire as needed. The smoke remains too dense for fixed wing airplanes at this time.
entry.content: The visibility has improved over the fire area today. Three helicopters have been dispatch to Moose Peak Fire and will be available to the West Fork Fire as needed. The smoke remains too dense for fixed wing airplanes at this time.

entry.title: Moose Peak and West Fork Fire Daily Fact Sheet 09.09.17
entry.summary: Skies will be mostly clear to moderately cloudy with limited smoke. A Red Flag Warning is in effect from 1400-2100 hours. A Red Flag Warning means conditions are ideal for wildland fire combustion and rapid spread when humidity is very low, especially when there are high or erratic winds. Southwest winds gusting up to 35 mph are possible. High temperatures will be in the 80’s with humidity near 25%.
entry.content: Skies will be mostly clear to moderately cloudy with limited smoke. A Red Flag Warning is in effect from 1400-2100 hours. A Red Flag Warning means conditions are ideal for wildland fire combustion and rapid spread when humidity is very low, especially when there are high or erratic winds. Southwest winds gusting up to 35 mph are possible. High temperatures will be in the 80’s with humidity near 25%.

entry.title: Evening Update 09/08/17
entry.summary: The burnout operation in the Bobtail Area will continue to burn through the night and burn in areas of unburned fuel within the fire perimeter. The operation was suspended this afternoon, due to the rise in humidity. The fuels were not burn completely, therefore the objective of the burn was not being accomplished. A crew will be monitoring the fire through the night.
entry.content: The burnout operation in the Bobtail Area will continue to burn through the night and burn in areas of unburned fuel within the fire perimeter. The operation was suspended this afternoon, due to the rise in humidity. The fuels were not burn completely, therefore the objective of the burn was not being accomplished. A crew will be monitoring the fire through the night.

entry.title: Moose Peak and West Fork Fire Daily Fact Sheet 09.08.17
entry.summary: Limited personnel and heavy equipment have arrived to assist in construction of fire line on the Moose Peak Fire. A dozer line has been created from Sylvan Lake approximately 2 miles to the northwest. A successful burn out was completed on the east side of the perimeter, combining the spot fires into the main fire. Plans are in place to construct additional line from Sylvan Lake east to McGinnis Meadows.
entry.content: Limited personnel and heavy equipment have arrived to assist in construction of fire line on the Moose Peak Fire. A dozer line has been created from Sylvan Lake approximately 2 miles to the northwest. A successful burn out was completed on the east side of the perimeter, combining the spot fires into the main fire. Plans are in place to construct additional line from Sylvan Lake east to McGinnis Meadows.

entry.title: Offical Public Meeting Tonight 09.08.17
entry.summary: The Rocky Mountain Area Blue Team will be holding a Public Meeting at the Thompson Lake Baptist Camp (also known as Thompson Lake Christian Retreat). Doors will open at 5:30pm, meeting will begin at 6:00pm. Incident Meteorologist, Incident Operation Section Chief and the Incident Commander will all be on hand to brief the public.
entry.content: The Rocky Mountain Area Blue Team will be holding a Public Meeting at the Thompson Lake Baptist Camp (also known as Thompson Lake Christian Retreat). Doors will open at 5:30pm, meeting will begin at 6:00pm. Incident Meteorologist, Incident Operation Section Chief and the Incident Commander will all be on hand to brief the public.

entry.title: West Fork and Moose Peak Daily Fact Sheet 09.08.17
entry.summary: The planned burnout over the last 2 days has been successful with approximately 900 acres completed. These operations were done in the Bobtail Ridge, Bobtail Ridge Road and Quartz Creek Road area. Firefighters lit a low intensity backing fire, beginning at Lindy Peak yesterday to the junction of Quartz Creek Road and Bobtail Ridge Road. Yesterday afternoon they reached the junction, and then proceeded to light along the Bobtail Ridge Road, north to the dozer line. A night crew monitored the burnout operations throughout the night. Today, as conditions allow, firefighters will continue along the Bobtail Ridge Road and the dozer line along Bobtail Ridge. The burnout operations will increase the buffer between the active fire and the residences in the area. The Quartz Creek Road is being improved as a containment line with heavy equipment is widening and removing trees and understory fuels.
entry.content: The planned burnout over the last 2 days has been successful with approximately 900 acres completed. These operations were done in the Bobtail Ridge, Bobtail Ridge Road and Quartz Creek Road area. Firefighters lit a low intensity backing fire, beginning at Lindy Peak yesterday to the junction of Quartz Creek Road and Bobtail Ridge Road. Yesterday afternoon they reached the junction, and then proceeded to light along the Bobtail Ridge Road, north to the dozer line. A night crew monitored the burnout operations throughout the night. Today, as conditions allow, firefighters will continue along the Bobtail Ridge Road and the dozer line along Bobtail Ridge. The burnout operations will increase the buffer between the active fire and the residences in the area. The Quartz Creek Road is being improved as a containment line with heavy equipment is widening and removing trees and understory fuels.

entry.title: Upcoming Public Meetings - Thompson Falls & Plains
entry.summary: Sept 8th in Thompson Falls at 7 PM at the Thompson Falls High School, Sept 9th in Plains at 7 PM at the Plains High School - The Western Montana Incident Management Team will be hosting public meetings to discuss the Highway 200 Complex Fires. Presentations will include an update and planned actions from operations, a discussion about evacuations from the Sheriff, updates from the Forest Service, and a closing message from the Incident Commander. Following the presentations, we will have a question and answer session and fire management personnel will stick around after the meeting for one-on-one discussions as needed. September 8thThompson Falls High School7 PMSeptember 9thPlains High School7
entry.content: Sept 8th in Thompson Falls at 7 PM at the Thompson Falls High School, Sept 9th in Plains at 7 PM at the Plains High School - The Western Montana Incident Management Team will be hosting public meetings to discuss the Highway 200 Complex Fires. Presentations will include an update and planned actions from operations, a discussion about evacuations from the Sheriff, updates from the Forest Service, and a closing message from the Incident Commander. Following the presentations, we will have a question and answer session and fire management personnel will stick around after the meeting for one-on-one discussions as needed. September 8thThompson Falls High School7 PMSeptember 9thPlains High School7

entry.title: Closure Order - Upper Clear Creek Area
entry.summary: September 7th, 2017 An area closure is now in place for the Clear Creek area. This closure includes Forest Service lands, roads, and trails and is intended for the protection of both firefighters and the public during fire suppression operations. For more details and a closure area map, please click the links to the right.
entry.content: September 7th, 2017 An area closure is now in place for the Clear Creek area. This closure includes Forest Service lands, roads, and trails and is intended for the protection of both firefighters and the public during fire suppression operations. For more details and a closure area map, please click the links to the right.

entry.title: Burnout Operation Progressing in the Bobtail Ridge Area today
entry.summary: As of 2:00pm, the planned burnout operation on the #WestForkFire is going as expected with a low intensity, backing fire. Crews are lighting from Lindy Peak south to the junction of Quartz Creek Road and Bobtail Ridge
entry.content: As of 2:00pm, the planned burnout operation on the #WestForkFire is going as expected with a low intensity, backing fire. Crews are lighting from Lindy Peak south to the junction of Quartz Creek Road and Bobtail Ridge

entry.title: Moose Peak and West Fork Fire Fact Sheet 09.07.17
entry.summary: Fire Information Number: (406) 209-9961 Evacuation Information: (406) 293-6295 Location: West Fork is 7 miles northwest of Libby, MT Size: 7,337 Cause: Lightning Containment: 0% Personnel: 139 Email: WestForkMoosePeakFires@gmail.com InciWeb: https:// inciweb.nwcg.gov/incident/5585/ Location: Moose Peak Fire originated near Moose Peak in Sanders County, MT Size: 5,717 Cause: Lightning Containment: 0% Personnel: 14 Email: WestForkMoosePeakFires@gmail.com InciWeb: https://inciweb.nwcg.gov/incident/5583/ Community Meeting at 6:00 p.m. at Libby Christian Church 100 Kootenai River Road Visit Lincoln County Webpage www.lincolncountymt.us to sign-up for the County Code Red system. Weather: The inversion this morning is expected to be dense, and then break at approximately 1:30pm. Winds will remain light; therefore, dense smoke will continue to settle in the area. The high pressure will move off to our southeast today. Temperatures and relative humidity will be similar to...
entry.content:
Moose Peak and West Fork Fire Fact Sheet 09.07.17

Incident: Moose Peak Wildfire
Released: 20 min. ago

Related Information

  • Moose Peak and West Fork Fires Fact Sheet 09.07.17 (pdf 273 kb)

Fire Information Number: (406) 209-9961 Evacuation Information: (406) 293-6295

Location: West Fork is 7 miles northwest of Libby, MT Size: 7,337

Cause: Lightning Containment: 0% Personnel: 139

Email: WestForkMoosePeakFires@gmail.com InciWeb: https:// inciweb.nwcg.gov/incident/5585/

Location: Moose Peak Fire originated near Moose Peak in Sanders County, MT Size: 5,717

Cause: Lightning Containment: 0% Personnel: 14

Email: WestForkMoosePeakFires@gmail.com InciWeb: https://inciweb.nwcg.gov/incident/5583/

Community Meeting at 6:00 p.m. at Libby Christian Church 100 Kootenai River Road

Visit Lincoln County Webpage www.lincolncountymt.us to sign-up for the County Code Red system.

Weather: The inversion this morning is expected to be dense, and then break at approximately 1:30pm. Winds will remain light; therefore, dense smoke will continue to settle in the area. The high pressure will move off to our southeast today. Temperatures and relative humidity will be similar to yesterday. Monsoonal moisture will stream into the region tomorrow (Friday) bringing a chance of showers and thunderstorms to the area. These storms will be isolated in nature and mostly dry as they cross northwestern Montana.

West Fork Fire Planned Actions: The planned burnout yesterday was successfully completed to Lindy Peak. This operation was done in the Bobtail Ridge and Bobtail Ridge Road area. Crews today will monitor/hold what was burned east of the Quartz /US F.S. 600 Road. A crew patrolled/monitored the burnout area throughout the night. When conditions allow, the burnout will continue from Lindy Peak south to the junction of Quartz Road and the Bobtail Ridge Road. The purpose of the burnout is to increase the buffer between the active fire and the residence in the area to obtain this objective, crews will light a low intensity, backing fire along the dozer line behind the homes on Bobtail Ridge Road. As resources arrive the Pipe Creek road will be improved as an indirect fireline. A dozer line has been identified to tie in Pipe Creek Road to the fire. The structure defense group will be preparing homes in the event of the fire becoming more active. Actions will include moving flammable materials away from the homes and installing sprinklers when supplies and crews arrive.

West Fork Fire Evacuations: New evacuation orders have issued, please check the Lincoln County Sheriff’s Facebook page or call (406) 293-6295 for the most up-to-date information on evacuations.

West Fork Fire Closures: The Kootenai Forest has issued a closure order in effect for the West Fork Fire. The map and order is located under the closure tap on the InciWeb Page.

Moose Peak Fire Planned Actions: Dozers will be constructing fireline today from Fishtrap Creek to Sylvan Lake; when appropriate and safe. As more equipment arrives, they will be placed in previous scouted areas to achieve fire manager’s objectives to protect values at risk. The Structure Defense crews will continue structure assessments on the Fisher Creek and McGinnis Meadows homes. As supplies and crews arrive, plans are in place to begin installing sprinklers around homes. Three spot fires grew together, and now form a part of the main fire.

Moose Peak Fire Pre - Evacuations: Please check the Lincoln County Sheriff’s Facebook page or call (406) 293-6295 for the most up-to-date information on evacuations.

Moose Peak Fire Closures: The Kootenai Forest has issued a closure order in effect for the Moose Peak Fire. The map and order is located under the closure tab on the InciWeb Page.

###

entry.content: The Rocky Mountain Incident Management Blue Team will hold a public meeting regarding the Moose Peak Fire on Friday, September 8th. The meeting will be held at the Thompson Baptist Church located at 593 ACM Road. The doors will open at 5:30pm and the meeting will begin at 6:00pm.

entry.title: Winds Expected - Saturday
entry.summary: The #WestForkFire and #MoosePeakFire will be expecting winds ranging from 20 to 25 mph on Saturday. These winds will be out of the west/southwest. Increased winds will reduce the amount of smoke settling in the area, however it will increase the fire behavior.
entry.content: The #WestForkFire and #MoosePeakFire will be expecting winds ranging from 20 to 25 mph on Saturday. These winds will be out of the west/southwest. Increased winds will reduce the amount of smoke settling in the area, however it will increase the fire behavior.

entry.title: West Fork and Moose Peak Fires Daily Update - 9/6/2017
entry.summary: Fire Information Number: (406) 209-9961 Evacuation Information: (406) 293-6295 Location: West Fork is 7 miles northwest of Libby, MT Size: 5,768 Cause: Lightning Containment: 0% Personnel: 108 Email: WestForkMoosePeakFires@gmail.com InciWeb: https:// inciweb.nwcg.gov/incident/5585/ Location: Moose Peak Fire originated near Moose Peak in Sanders County, MT Size: 4,993 Cause: Lightning Containment: 0% Personnel: 7 Email: WestForkMoosePeakFires@gmail.com InciWeb: https://inciweb.nwcg.gov/incident/5583/ Visit Lincoln County Webpage www.lincolncountymt.us to sign-up for the County Code Red system. Weather: The inversion this morning is expected to be dense and lift later in the day. Winds will remain light; therefore, dense smoke will continue to settle in the area. Temperatures will be higher than yesterday and relative humidity will be lower. West Fork Fire Planned Actions: The planned...
entry.content:
West Fork and Moose Peak Fires Daily Update - 9/6/2017

Incident: West Fork Fire Wildfire
Released: 29 min. ago

Related Information

  • West Fork and Moose Peak Fires Update 9/6/2017 (pdf 270 kb)

Fire Information Number: (406) 209-9961 Evacuation Information: (406) 293-6295

Location: West Fork is 7 miles northwest of Libby, MT Size: 5,768

Cause: Lightning Containment: 0% Personnel: 108

Email: WestForkMoosePeakFires@gmail.com InciWeb: https:// inciweb.nwcg.gov/incident/5585/

Location: Moose Peak Fire originated near Moose Peak in Sanders County, MT Size: 4,993

Cause: Lightning Containment: 0% Personnel: 7

Email: WestForkMoosePeakFires@gmail.com InciWeb: https://inciweb.nwcg.gov/incident/5583/

Visit Lincoln County Webpage www.lincolncountymt.us to sign-up for the County Code Red system.

Weather: The inversion this morning is expected to be dense and lift later in the day. Winds will remain light; therefore, dense smoke will continue to settle in the area. Temperatures will be higher than yesterday and relative humidity will be lower.

West Fork Fire Planned Actions: The planned burnout for last night was postponed, due to the increase in humidity. The burnout operation will resume when conditions allow. Burnout operations are only done under certain weather and fuel conditions to ensure the fire behavior is minimal. This operation is planned for the Bobtail ridge and Bobtail Ridge Road area. Crews will light down the Bobtail Ridge and the Bobtail Ridge Road simultaneously from the north to the south. Firefighters will not be lighting off the dozer lines near the homes on Bobtail Road. The purpose of the burnout is to increase the buffer between the active fire and the residence in the area, allowing for quicker re-entry into the evacuation area. The structure defense group will be preparing homes in the event of the fire becoming more active. These crews will be moving flammable materials away from the homes and installing sprinklers when supplies arrive.

West Fork Fire Evacuations: No additional evacuations have been issued; please check the Lincoln County Sheriff’s Facebook page or call (406) 293-6295 for the most up-to-date information on evacuations.

West Fork Fire Closures: The Kootenai Forest has issued a closure order in effect for the West Fork Fire. The map and order is located under the closure tap on the InciWeb Page.

Moose Peak Fire Planned Actions: Fire managers are working to obtain resources necessary to complete fire objectives on the Moose Peak Fire. Potential fire lines are being scouted on all areas of the fire, as appropriate and available equipment will be utilized to construct indirect and direct firelines. The Structure Defense crews will continue structure assessments on the Fisher Creek and McGinnis Meadows homes. As supplies arrive, crews will begin installing sprinklers around homes in the event of the fire behavior increasing.

Moose Peak Fire Pre - Evacuations: No additional pre-evacuations and evacuations have been issued; please check the Lincoln County Sheriff’s Facebook page or call (406) 293-6295 for the most up-to-date information on evacuations.

Moose Peak Fire Closures: The Kootenai Forest has issued a closure order in effect for the Moose Peak Fire. The map and order is located under the closure tab on the InciWeb Page.

###

Location: Moose Peak Fire originated near Moose Peak in Sanders County, MT Size: 4,993

Cause: Lightning Containment: 0% Personnel: 7

Email: WestForkMoosePeakFires@gmail.com InciWeb: https://inciweb.nwcg.gov/incident/5583/

Visit Lincoln County Webpage www.lincolncountymt.us to sign-up for the County Code Red system.

Weather: The inversion this morning is expected to be dense and lift later in the day. Winds will remain light; therefore, dense smoke will continue to settle in the area. Temperatures will be higher than yesterday and relative humidity will be lower.

West Fork Fire Planned Actions: The planned burnout for last night was postponed, due to the increase in humidity. The burnout operation will resume when conditions allow. Burnout operations are only done under certain weather and fuel conditions to ensure the fire behavior is minimal. This operation is planned for the Bobtail ridge and Bobtail Ridge Road area. Crews will light down the Bobtail Ridge and the Bobtail Ridge Road simultaneously from the north to the south. Firefighters will not be lighting off the dozer lines near the homes on Bobtail Road. The purpose of the burnout is to increase the buffer between the active fire and the residence in the area, allowing for quicker re-entry into the evacuation area. The structure defense group will be preparing homes in the event of the fire becoming more active. These crews will be moving flammable materials away from the homes and installing sprinklers when supplies arrive.

West Fork Fire Evacuations: No additional evacuations have been issued; please check the Lincoln County Sheriff’s Facebook page or call (406) 293-6295 for the most up-to-date information on evacuations.

West Fork Fire Closures: The Kootenai Forest has issued a closure order in effect for the West Fork Fire. The map and order is located under the closure tap on the InciWeb Page.

Moose Peak Fire Planned Actions: Fire managers are working to obtain resources necessary to complete fire objectives on the Moose Peak Fire. Potential fire lines are being scouted on all areas of the fire, as appropriate and available equipment will be utilized to construct indirect and direct firelines. The Structure Defense crews will continue structure assessments on the Fisher Creek and McGinnis Meadows homes. As supplies arrive, crews will begin installing sprinklers around homes in the event of the fire behavior increasing.

Moose Peak Fire Pre - Evacuations: No additional pre-evacuations and evacuations have been issued; please check the Lincoln County Sheriff’s Facebook page or call (406) 293-6295 for the most up-to-date information on evacuations.

Moose Peak Fire Closures: The Kootenai Forest has issued a closure order in effect for the Moose Peak Fire. The map and order is located under the closure tab on the InciWeb Page.

###

entry.title: Plains Public Meeting, Tonight, 7 PM, High School
entry.summary: The Western Montana Incident Management Team will be hosting a public meeting, tonight, at the Plains High School. Please note, the meeting is schedule for 7 PM to accommodate the school's sports schedule. Presentations will include the current status of Highway 200 Complex fires and planned actions, as well as information about evacuations and public safety concerns. There will also be a question and answer session following the presentations.
entry.content: The Western Montana Incident Management Team will be hosting a public meeting, tonight, at the Plains High School. Please note, the meeting is schedule for 7 PM to accommodate the school's sports schedule. Presentations will include the current status of Highway 200 Complex fires and planned actions, as well as information about evacuations and public safety concerns. There will also be a question and answer session following the presentations.

Visit Lincoln County Webpage www.lincolncountymt.us to sign-up for the County Code Red system. Weather: Skies are expected to be clear today, however smoke in the area will shade the fire area moderating fire behavior. Easterly winds are likely at the ridgetops with...
entry.content:
Moose Peak and West Fork Fire Daily Update 9/5/2017

Incident: Moose Peak Wildfire
Released: 24 min. ago

Fire Information Number: (406) 209-9961

Location: West Fork/Mount Tom is 7 miles northwest of Libby, MT Size: 5,760

Cause: Lightning Containment: 0% Personnel: 54

Email: WestForkMoosePeakFires@gmail.com InciWeb: https:// inciweb.nwcg.gov/incident/5585/

Location: Moose Peak Fire originated near Moose Peak in Sanders County, MT Size: 4,993

Cause: Lightning Containment: 0% Personnel: 3

Email: WestForkMoosePeakFires@gmail.com InciWeb: https://inciweb.nwcg.gov/incident/5583/

The Rocky Mountain Area Incident Management Blue Team, Jay Esperance Incident Commander, assumed command of the West Fork/Mount Tom and Moose Peak Fires this morning at 6:00am.

Visit Lincoln County Webpage www.lincolncountymt.us to sign-up for the County Code Red system.

Weather: Skies are expected to be clear today, however smoke in the area will shade the fire area moderating fire behavior. Easterly winds are likely at the ridgetops with upslope/up-valley winds in the valleys and on the slopes. The inversion this morning will lift out of the valleys around noon.

West Fork/Mount Tom Fire Planned Actions: The West Fork and Mount Tom fires grew together last night. The fires in future will be referred to as the West Fork Fire. Firefighters will be working on USFS 600 constructing fire line and improving the road as a containment line. Dozers and other heavy equipment will be working north of the Bobtail Community connecting dozer lines to construct indirect containment lines, which will later be used to conduct burnout operations. The structure defense group will be providing point protection and evaluating values a risk.

West Fork Fire Evacuations: No additional evacuations have been issued; please check the Lincoln County Sheriff’s Facebook page or call (406) 293-6295 for the most up-to-date information on evacuations.

West Fork Fire Closures: The Kootenai Forest has issued a closure order in effect for the West Fork Fire. The map and order is located under the closure tap on the InciWeb Page.

Moose Peak Fire Planned Actions: The Moose Peak Fire originated in Sanders County on the Cabinet Ranger District on August 30. The Moose Peak Fire has previously been under the jurisdiction of the Highway 200 Complex, as of today it will be managed by the Rocky Mountain Area Blue Team. Today, firefighters will be scouting each division of the fire looking for areas where direct line construction will be appropriate. The structure defense group will be providing point protection and evaluating values a risk.

Moose Peak Fire Pre - Evacuations: No additional pre-evacuations and evacuations have been issued; please check the Lincoln County Sheriff’s Facebook page or call (406) 293-6295 for the most up-to-date information on evacuations.

Moose Peak Fire Closures: The Kootenai Forest has issued a closure order in effect for the Moose Peak Fire. The map and order is located under the closure tap on the InciWeb Page.

###

entry.title: Moose Peak and Miller Fires Closure Area

The closure cited in this order is to protect the public from potential harm from wildfires and firefighting operations associated with the Moose Peak and Miller Fires. This closure order is effective upon signing and is in effect until rescinded. Periodic assessments will be conducted to evaluate closure needs. USDA Forest Service Pursuant to Title 36 Code of Federal Regulations 261.50(a), the following act is prohibited as prescribed below within the Plains/Thompson Falls Ranger District of the Lolo National Forest. These restrictions are in addition to those enumerated in Subpart A, Part 261, Title 36, Code of Federal Regulations, and become effective upon signing and will remain in effect until rescinded. 36 CFR – Special Closures It is prohibited...
entry.content:
Moose Peak and Miller Fires Closure Area

Incident: Highway 200 Complex Wildfire
Released: 17 min. ago

Related Information

  • Closure Area Map - Moos Peak and Miller Fires (pdf 1,265 kb)

Moose Peak and Miller Fires

Multi-Jurisdictional Area Closure Order

The USDA Forest Service and Weyerhaeuser jointly restrict public access to lands under their jurisdiction described within this order. The closure cited in this order is to protect the public from potential harm from wildfires and firefighting operations associated with the Moose Peak and Miller Fires.

This closure order is effective upon signing and is in effect until rescinded. Periodic assessments will be conducted to evaluate closure needs.

USDA Forest Service

Pursuant to Title 36 Code of Federal Regulations 261.50(a), the following act is prohibited as prescribed below within the Plains/Thompson Falls Ranger District of the Lolo National Forest. These restrictions are in addition to those enumerated in Subpart A, Part 261, Title 36, Code of Federal Regulations, and become effective upon signing and will remain in effect until rescinded.

36 CFR – Special Closures

It is prohibited to go into or be upon the area (36 CFR 261.53(e)).

The closure cited in this order is to protect the public from potential harm from wildfires and firefighting operation associate with the Moose Peak and Miller Fires.

Description of Closed Areas

On National Forest System lands, this order closes the following area (see-attached map):

· The Fishtrap Drainage and its tributaries from the confluence of Beatrice Creek and Fishtrap Creek north to the common boundary between the Lolo and Kootenai National Forests, east to the Forest Boundary, and west to the common boundary between the Lolo and Kootenai National Forests generally including the following tributary drainages:

o Young Creek

o West Fork Fishtrap Creek, including the West Fork Fishtrap Creek Campground

o Whiteface Creek

o Beartrap Creek

o Cool Creek

o Radio Creek, including Fishtrap Lake and the Fishtrap Lake Campground

o Mantrap Creek

o Daisy Creek

o Little Creek

o Shorthorn Gulch

o Shale Creek

It is prohibited to be on roads (36 CFR 261.54(e)); trails (36 CFR 261.55(a)), and campgrounds within the closure perimeter.

Exemptions

Pursuant to 36 CFR 261.50(e), the following persons are exempt from this order:

1. Persons with a permit specifically authorizing the otherwise prohibited act or omission.

2. Any Federal, State, or local officer, or member of an organized rescue or firefighting force in the performance of an official duty.

Penalty

Violation of these prohibitions is punishable by a fine of not more than $5000 for an individual, or $10,000 for an organization, or imprisonment for not more than 6 months, or both (16 USC 551 and 18, USC 3559 and 3571).

Notification

A copy of this order shall be posted as prescribed in 36 CFR 261.51.

Sanders County, Montana DNRC, Weyerhaeuser

Sanders County, Montana DNRC, and Weyerhaeuser close the lands under their jurisdiction within the perimeter identified within this order except for privately owned land in the following locations Sections 8 and 18, T24N, R27W, Section 32, T25N, R27W, and Section 1, T25N, R28W.

Signed in Missoula, Montana, this 4th day of September 2017.

_________________________________ ________________________________

Timothy P. Garcia Tom Ray

Forest Supervisor Weyerhaeuser

Lolo National Forest Montana Resource Team Leader

________________________________ _________________________________

Tom Rummel Tony Cox

Sanders County Sheriff Sanders County Commissioner

________________________________

Dave Olsen

Montana DNRC

Plains Unit Manager

entry.summary: Order No. F17-077-LOLO-D5Pursuant to Title 36 Code of Federal Regulations 261.50 (a&b), the following acts are prohibited as described below within the Plains/ Thompson Falls Ranger District of the Lolo National Forest. these restrictions are in addition to those enumerated in Subpart A, Part 261, Title 36, Code of Federal Regulations, and become effective upon signing and will remain in effect until rescinded. 36 CFR - Special Closures It is prohibited to go into or be upon the area (36 CFR 261.53(e)).The closure cited in this order is to protect the public from harm from wildfires and firefighting operations associated with the Deep Creek Fire.Description of Closed Areas: This area closure closes the area as described below and shown on the ATTACHED MAP.All of sections 3-8, and parts of sections 1,2,9-11, & 16-19, T. 22N., R. 29 W.Part of section 1, T. 22N., R. 30 W.All of sections and protracted Blocks PB37, PB38, 8, 16, 17, PB39, PB40, 20-23, 27-29, PB41, PB42,PB47, T. 23 N., R....
entry.content:
Closure Order

Incident: Highway 200 Complex Wildfire
Released: 34 min. ago

Order No. F17-077-LOLO-D5

Pursuant to Title 36 Code of Federal Regulations 261.50 (a&b;), the following acts are prohibited as described below within the Plains/ Thompson Falls Ranger District of the Lolo National Forest. these restrictions are in addition to those enumerated in Subpart A, Part 261, Title 36, Code of Federal Regulations, and become effective upon signing and will remain in effect until rescinded.

36 CFR - Special Closures

It is prohibited to go into or be upon the area (36 CFR 261.53(e)).

The closure cited in this order is to protect the public from harm from wildfires and firefighting operations associated with the Deep Creek Fire.

Description of Closed Areas:

This area closure closes the area as described below and shown on the ATTACHED MAP.

All of sections 3-8, and parts of sections 1,2,9-11, & 16-19, T. 22N., R. 29 W.
Part of section 1, T. 22N., R. 30 W.
All of sections and protracted Blocks PB37, PB38, 8, 16, 17, PB39, PB40, 20-23, 27-29, PB41, PB42,
PB47, T. 23 N., R. 29 W.
All of sections 1, 11-15, & 23-25, and parts of sections 2, 9, 10, 22, 26, 36, T. 23 N., R. 30 W.
Parts of sections and protracted Blocks 30, PB45, & 32, T. 24N., R. 29 W.
All of Protracted Block PB52 and part of section 25 and part of Protracted Block PB51, T. 24 N., R. 30 W

36 CFR - National Forest System Roads

Being on the road. 36 CRF 261.54(e)). It is prohibited to be on the road.

The closure cited in this order is to protect the public from potential harm form wilfires and firefighting operations associated with the Deep Creek Fire.

Description of Closed Road:

Including all road encompassed by the area closure. See description of area closure above. See attached map.

36 CFR - National Forest System Trails

Being on the trail. 36 CFR 261.55(a). It is prohibited to be on the trail.

the closure cited in this order is to protect the public from potential harm form wildfires and firefighting operations associate with the Deep Creek Fire.

Description of Trails:

Including all trails encompassed by the area closure. See description of area closure above. See attached map.

Exemptions:

Pursuant to 36 CFR 261.50(e), the following persons re exempt from this order:

1. Persons with a permit issued by a forest officer speifically authorizing the otherwise prohibited act or omission.
2. Any Federal, State, or local officer, or member of an organized rescue or firefighting force in the performance of an official duty.

Signed in Missoula, Montana, this 1st day of Sepember, 2017.

Timothy Garcia
Forest Supervisor
Lolo National Forest

Penalty: Violation of these prohibitions is punishable by a fine of not more than $5000 for and individual or $10,000 for an organization, or imprisonment for not more than 6 months, or both (16 USC 551 and 18 USC 3559 and 3571).

Notification: A copy of this order shall be posted as prescribed in 36 CFR 261.51.

Sheriff Facebook. entry.title: Fire Update 9/3 2 p.m.
entry.summary: West Fork Fire Fact Sheet: September 3, 2017 2:00 pm Location: West Fork Fire is located 5 miles North of Kootenai River Road. Cause: Lightning Current Size: 1600 acres Contact: westforkfire2017@gmail.com/wsykes@fs.fed.us Announcement: A public meeting will be held for the West Fork Fire on Sunday September 3, 2017 from 4:00-5:00 PM at Libby Middle/High School, 150 Education Way, Libby, MT. Fire: The West Fork Fire is located in the Quartz Creek/Bobtail Ridge area on the Libby Ranger District of the Kootenai National Forest. The West Fork Fire started Wednesday morning. A local Type 3 Fire Response Team is in place providing fire suppression strategies. The team will continue to use heavy equipment to construct shaded fuel breaks with weather dictating line construction activities. The Fire Team is using J. Neil’s Park to stage equipment. Please be cautious and drive slowly when accessing the park. Evacuations: An Evacuation Order has been issued by the...
entry.content:
Fire Update 9/3 2 p.m.

Incident: West Fork Fire Wildfire
Released: 30 min. ago

West Fork Fire Fact Sheet:

September 3, 2017 2:00 pm


Location: West Fork Fire is located 5 miles North of Kootenai River Road.

Cause: Lightning

Current Size: 1600 acres

Contact: westforkfire2017@gmail.com/wsykes@fs.fed.us

Announcement: A public meeting will be held for the West Fork Fire on Sunday September 3, 2017 from 4:00-5:00 PM at Libby Middle/High School, 150 Education Way, Libby, MT.

Fire: The West Fork Fire is located in the Quartz Creek/Bobtail Ridge area on the Libby Ranger District of the Kootenai National Forest. The West Fork Fire started Wednesday morning. A local Type 3 Fire Response Team is in place providing fire suppression strategies. The team will continue to use heavy equipment to construct shaded fuel breaks with weather dictating line construction activities. The Fire Team is using J. Neil’s Park to stage equipment. Please be cautious and drive slowly when accessing the park.

Evacuations: An Evacuation Order has been issued by the Sheriff’s Office for 17 Mile Community Area.

A Pre-Evacuation Warning has been issued by the Sheriff’s Office for the upper end of Bobtail Road north of Bobtail Cutoff, Hutton Drive, Bobtail Cut-off, including Winter Road and Whitetail Road, Pipe Creek Road from Forest Way, including Lodge Pole Road, Blue Mountain Lookout Road and Doak Creek Road, and Creekside Road.

Lincoln County Sheriff’s Office is working closely with local fire departments and the Fire Response Team to identify opportunities to work with landowners to keep them aware of the fire situation.


Closures: Go to the Kootenai webpage at https://www.fs.usda.gov/kootenai for the latest on Closure Orders and KNF fire vicinity map. Pipe Creek Road is closed from mile marker 10 to the summit.

Lincoln County Sheriff’s Office is asking the public to avoid the Pipe Creek Road, Kootenai River Road, Quartz Creek Road, Quartz Mountain Road, Bobtail Road and Bobtail Cutoff areas to allow for safe fire response and public safety. The fall hunting season officially started yesterday with archery season, please avoid active fire areas.

Forecasted Weather: A red flag warning will be in effect on Sunday from noon to 9:00 PM. Hot and dry conditions will continue today with breezy afternoon winds. Winds are expected to pick up sometime between 3 and 6 pm. A Canadian cold front will bring a shift in wind direction Sunday night with winds becoming north to northeasterly.

The fire is actively burning so people can expect to see smoke in the air. Check todaysair.mt.gov for real time updates on air quality and outdoor activity recommendations.

For updated fire information visit: https://inciweb.nwcg.gov/incident/5585/


Fire Restrictions: Stage II Fire Restrictions are in effect for Lincoln County and Kootenai National Forest due to extreme fire danger. Current fire conditions can be found at www.firerestrictions.us.

The Lincoln So. Sheriff's Office is asking the public to avoid the Pipe Creek Road, Kootenai River Road, Quartz Creek Road, Quartz Mountain Road, Bobtail Road, and Bobtail Cutoff areas to allow for safe fire response and public

Check todaysair.mt.gov for real time updates on air quality and outdoor activity recommendations.

Fire Restrictions: Stage II Fire Restrictions are in effect for Lincoln County and Kootenai National Forest due to extreme fire danger. Current fire conditions can be found at www.firerestrictions.us.

entry.title: Public Meeting, Today, 1 PM, Plains High School
entry.summary: The Western Montana Incident Management Team will be hosting a public meeting to discuss the current status and outlook for the fires near Plains, Thompson Falls, and Trout Creek. Fire managers, Sheriff Officers, and Forest Service representatives will be there to answer questions. Please share with all interested parties. For more information, contact the Public Information Officers at (406) 219-1960 or hwy200complex@gmail.com.

Fire managers, Sheriff Officers, and Forest Service representatives will be there to answer questions. Please share with all interested parties. For more information, contact the Public Information Officers at (406) 219-1960 or hwy200complex@gmail.com.
